citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
* A female, Miniature Pinscher (ID # 933041000002684) was seen squinting with a glob of whitish colored discharge in
the outer corner of the right eye. Under the glob of discharge the eyelid appeared slightly crusted over. Upon examination
of the eye an indentation (approximate size the tip of a ballpoint pen) was observed. Eye issues may be painful and
indicative of injury, irritation or other medical conditions. Licensee must ensure this dog is examined by a veterinarian to
prevent further pain, suffering or damage to the eye as soon as possible (preferably within a couple of days.) DIRECT
- The toenails on the dog's feet were long with at least one of them curving around causing the toe to splay to the side
while walking. Long toenails can be painful and impair the dogs ability to maintain correct posture during normal
movement. Licensee must trim toenails and maintain appropriate length to allow for normal movement and minimize
injury.
* The following medication was past the labeled expiration date: Metronidazole Tablets 250 mg – August 2022. This
medication was intermingled with other products that are currently being used at the facility (110 dogs) and therefore was
ready for use. Expired drugs may not work as anticipated, could become contaminated, and could harm the animals. The
licensee must ensure that all medications used in the facility are not expired, labeled properly in accordance with standard
veterinary practices, and are stored in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations.
This inspection and phone exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
ANGELA DEPOE, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
* A female, Miniature Pinscher (ID # 933041000002684) was seen squinting with a glob of whitish colored discharge in 
the outer corner of the right eye. Under the glob of discharge the eyelid appeared slightly crusted over. Upon examination 
of the eye an indentation (approximate size the tip of a ballpoint pen) was observed. Eye issues may be painful and 
indicative of injury, irritation or other medical conditions. Licensee must ensure this dog is examined by a veterinarian to 
prevent further pain, suffering or damage to the eye as soon as possible (preferably within a couple of days.) DIRECT 
 
- The toenails on the dog's feet were long with at least one of them curving around causing the toe to splay to the side 
while walking. Long toenails can be painful and impair the dogs ability to maintain correct posture during normal 
movement. Licensee must trim toenails and maintain appropriate length to allow for normal movement and minimize 
injury. 
 
* The following medication was past the labeled expiration date: Metronidazole Tablets 250 mg – August 2022. This 
medication was intermingled with other products that are currently being used at the facility (110 dogs) and therefore was 
ready for use. Expired drugs may not work as anticipated, could become contaminated, and could harm the animals. The 
licensee must ensure that all medications used in the facility are not expired, labeled properly in accordance with standard 
veterinary practices, and are stored in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations. 
 
This inspection and phone exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
ANGELA DEPOE, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n
